com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.security.icp4d

Class ICP4DToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.security.icp4d.ICP4DToken

  • public class ICP4DToken
extends Object
    This class holds relevant info re: an ICP4D access token for use by the ICP4DAuthenticator class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String accessToken 
      long expirationTimeInMillis 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ICP4DToken(ICP4DTokenResponse response)
      This ctor will extract the ICP4D access token from the specified ICP4DTokenResponse instance, and compute the expiration time as "80% of the timeToLive added to the issued-at time".
      ICP4DToken(String accessToken)
      This ctor is used to store a user-managed access token which will never expire.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isTokenValid()
      Returns true iff this object holds a valid non-expired access token.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • accessToken

        public String accessToken

      • expirationTimeInMillis

        public long expirationTimeInMillis

    • Constructor Detail

      • ICP4DToken

        public ICP4DToken(String accessToken)
        This ctor is used to store a user-managed access token which will never expire.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - the user-managed access token

      • ICP4DToken

        public ICP4DToken(ICP4DTokenResponse response)
        This ctor will extract the ICP4D access token from the specified ICP4DTokenResponse instance, and compute the expiration time as "80% of the timeToLive added to the issued-at time". This means that we'll trigger the acquisition of a new token shortly before it is set to expire.
        Parameters:
        response - the ICP4DTokenResponse instance

    • Method Detail

      • isTokenValid

        public boolean isTokenValid()
        Returns true iff this object holds a valid non-expired access token.
        Returns:
        true if token is valid and not expired, false otherwise
